sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with singular matrices
message_1:
Consider the following system of linear equations:
$$\begin{cases}2x+y-z=3\\3x+2y-2z=4\\-2x+4y-6z=7\end{cases}$$

(a) Determine whether the coefficient matrix is singular or non-singular.

(b) If the coefficient matrix is singular, find the values of $x$, $y$, and $z$ that satisfy the system. If the coefficient matrix is non-singular, then state that no solutions exist.
message_2:
(a) First, we need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix. The coefficient matrix is:

$$A = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 1 & -1 \\ 3 & 2 & -2 \\ -2 & 4 & -6 \end{bmatrix}$$

To find the determinant, we can use the following formula:

$$\det(A) = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg)$$

where $a, b, c, d, e, f, g, h, i$ are the elements of the matrix:

$$\det(A) = 2(2(-6) - (-2)(4)) - 1(3(-6) - (-2)(-2)) - 1(3(4) - 2(-2))$$

$$\det(A) = 2(-12 + 8) - 1(-18 + 4) - (12 + 4)$$

$$\det(A) = 2(-4) + 14 - 16$$

$$\det(A) = -8 + 14 - 16$$

$$\det(A) = -10$$

Since the determinant is not equal to zero, the coefficient matrix is non-singular.

(b) Since the coefficient matrix is non-singular, we can find the unique solution for the system of linear equations. We can use the inverse of the coefficient matrix to find the solution:

$$A^{-1} = \frac{1}{\det(A)} \begin{bmatrix} ei - fh & ch - bi & bf - ce \\ fg - di & ai - cg & cd - af \\ dh - eg & bg - ah & ae - bd \end{bmatrix}$$

$$A^{-1} = \frac{1}{-10} \begin{bmatrix} -12 + 8 & -6 + 1 & 4 - 2 \\ 12 - 6 & -6 + 12 & 6 - 4 \\ 8 - 12 & 8 - 4 & 4 - 6 \end{bmatrix}$$

$$A^{-1} = \frac{1}{-10} \begin{bmatrix} -4 & -5 & 2 \\ 6 & 6 & 2 \\ -4 & 4 & -2 \end{bmatrix}$$

Now, we can multiply $A^{-1}$ by the constant matrix $B$ to find the solution:

$$\begin{bmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{bmatrix} = A^{-1}B = \frac{1}{-10} \begin{bmatrix} -4 & -5 & 2 \\ 6 & 6 & 2 \\ -4 & 4 & -2 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 3 \\ 4 \\ 7 \end{bmatrix}$$

$$\begin{bmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{bmatrix} = \frac{1}{-10} \begin{bmatrix} -12 - 20 + 14 \\ 18 + 24 + 14 \\ -12 + 16 - 14 \end{bmatrix}$$

$$\begin{bmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{bmatrix} = \frac{1}{-10} \begin{bmatrix} -18 \\ 56 \\ -10 \end{bmatrix}$$

$$\begin{bmatrix} x \\ y \\ z \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 1.8 \\ -5.6 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}$$

So, the unique solution for the system of linear equations is $x = 1.8$, $y = -5.6$, and $z = 1$.
